titles.title: To prevent Members of Congress from receiving any automatic pay adjustment which might otherwise take effect in 2002.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committee on Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Civil Service and Agency Organization.

bill.summary: 1/31/2001--Introduced. Prohibits increases in the rate of pay for Members of Congress by reason of any automatic pay adjustment which would otherwise take effect under the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 in 2002.
